performers

Class Player

  • Object
    • performers.Player
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Warrior, Wizard

    public abstract class Player
extends Object
    A superclass for organizing the common code of all kinds of player subclasses. An abstract class cannot be initialized, so initialize subclasses of it instead. For subclasses, we are forced to write the code of the abstract methods. For regular methods in the superclass, we get to use these in any subclass, without having to write them in the subclasses again and again.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player(int hitPoints,
              int strength,
              int wisdom)
        This superclass constructor should take care of common setup for creating instances of *any subclass* of person the player chooses. So calling super() for any subclass constructors saves you from writing this code again.
        Parameters:
        hitPoints - The number of points a player has to stay alive.
        strength - A basic measure of the amount of strength a player has. This could be used to help calculate attack damage to hit points of monsters.
        wisdom - A basic measure of the amount of wisdom a player has. This could be used to help calculate the amount of spell effects.

    • Method Detail

      • getMaxHitPoints

        public int getMaxHitPoints()
        A method to get the maximum possible hit points for the player. You could use this value to help you calculate results for situations you design.
        Returns:
        An integer for the largest possible hit points of the player.

      • getHitPoints

        public int getHitPoints()
        To find out the current hit points status of the player.
        Returns:
        An integer for the current hit point value.

      • damageHitPoints

        public void damageHitPoints(int damage)
        Decreases hit points of this player.
        Parameters:
        damage - The amount of damage this player is receiving.

      • getStrength

        public int getStrength()
        To find out the strength of the player.
        Returns:
        An integer for the strength of the player.

      • getWisdom

        public int getWisdom()
        To find out the wisdom of the player.
        Returns:
        An integer for the wisdom of the player.

      • setHitPoints

        public void setHitPoints(int hitPoints)
        To change the value of the player's current hit points.
        Parameters:
        hitPoints - The value to save as the current hit points.

      • setStrength

        public void setStrength(int strength)
        To change the value of the player's strength.
        Parameters:
        strength - The value to save as the player's strength.

      • setWisdom

        public void setWisdom(int wisdom)
        To change the value of the player's wisdom.
        Parameters:
        wisdom - The value to save as the player's wisdom.

      • isDead

        public boolean isDead()
        Checks whether this montser is dead or still alive.
        Returns:
        A value of true if this player has no hit points, and false otherwise.

      • attack

        public abstract String[] attack(Monster... monsters)
        Every kind of player should implement their own version of an attack.
        Parameters:
        monsters - The attack should affect one, some, or all of the monsters. You decide how this should be implemented in subclasses.
        Returns:
        An array of strings, describing the results of this player attack on the monsters.

      • castSpell

        public abstract String[] castSpell(Monster... monsters)
        Every kind of player should implement their own version of a spell to cast.
        Parameters:
        monsters - The spell should affect one, some, or all of the monsters. You decide how this should be implemented in subclasses.
        Returns:
        An array of strings, describing the results of this player spell on the monsters.
